title: What are good examples of B2B companies using location based services? - Quora

response.answer_text: Use of Location & Messaging in B2B applications is gradually taking off (more in some sectors than others).   Use cases include roadside assistance, mobile workforce management, checkin/checkout for mobile timeclocking, asset & vehicle tracking, emergency responders, geotagged enterprise messaging, proximity marketing etc.  Examples include Actsoft, Xora, NetworkFleet, ClickSoft, ServiceMax, Placecast, Abaqus (my Company provides an LBS platform for such B2B services at http://www.mygeotracking.com) etc.

I've heard of some companies using checkin services to replace their existing Clock-In systems, which could also help co-workers know where their other co-workers have checked in at. I work for Qubulus, and indoor positioning provider, and we provide similar services that take into account users locations within a building. http://loclizard.com/products/iguana/
